alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 9:46AM EST until February 16 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CST/1245 PM EST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky and SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Hardin, Larue, Nelson and Washington. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Grayson, Green, Hart, Marion and Taylor. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CST /1245 PM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 AM CST /946 AM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Campbellsville, Lebanon, Hodgenville, Springfield, Munfordville, New Haven, Loretto, Upton and Sonora. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
